attributes.action: ensure funds are provided to maintain the memory of the 1.1 million victims murdered in Auschwitz. We believe Britain and Europe have a core duty to keep the memory of the Holocaust alive and invite the Prime Minister to provide funding for the maintenance of the site and urge his European counterparts to do the same.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The BBC has reported that only a few of what were originally hundreds of structures remain standing in the Auschwitz concentration camp, and those which have survived are gradually rotting away. 

The Auschwitz Museum is in a financial crisis and desperately needs funds to ensure its place so that future generations never forget the atrocities that took place there.

We urge the Prime Minister to provide part of the funds and raise concerns with his German, Polish and other European counterparts to keep the memory of this poignant place of history alive.
